document.masterDocTitle: New Sensiava species (Copepoda: Calanoida: Diaixidae) from the deep South Atlantic and first description of the female

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Sensiava species (Copepoda: Calanoida: Diaixidae) from the deep South Atlantic and first description of the female

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
Adult female, dissected, body length 3.30 mm. ZMH Reg. no. K– 42161 . Collected on
20 March 2005
by the DIVA –II expedition above the sea bed at abyssal depths ( 5142 m ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Sensiava secunda
sp. nov.
Female, holotype. A, habitus, dorsal view; B, habitus, lateral view; C, rostrum, lateral view; D, urosome, dorsal view; E, genital double somite, ventral view; F, urosome, lateral view; G, genital field, lateral view; H, P5, posterior view. Scale bars: A–B 0.5 mm, C–H 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 2 .
Sensiava secunda
sp. nov.
Female, holotype. A, antennule, articulating segments 1–16 (ancestral segments I–XIX); B, antennule, articulating segments 17–24 (ancestral segments XX–XXVIII); C, antenna; D, mandible, palp; E, mandible, gnathobase cutting edge; F, P1, anterior. Scale bars 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 3 .
Sensiava secunda
sp. nov.
Female, holotype. A, maxillule; B, maxillule, praecoxal arthrite, posterior and anterior setae (thick short arrow marks distalmost terminal seta curved at the apex, thin long arrow marks posterior and anterior setae); C, maxilla, brush-like setae of endopod are not figured; D, maxilla, sensory setae of endopod; E, maxilliped. Scale bars 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 4.
Sensiava secunda
sp. nov.
Female, holotype; A, maxilliped, endopod segments4 and 5; B, P2; C, P3; D P4. Scale bar 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratype ,
Body length 3.00 mm. ZMH Reg. no. K–
42162, 1
adult female, dissected, the same label data as for the holotype .

Description. Female. Body length 3.30–3.00 mm. Prosome 3.9–3.8 times as long as urosome (
Fig. 1
A–B). Rostrum as 2 filaments (
Fig. 1
C). Cephalosome and pedigerous somite 1 incompletely separate, and pedigerous somites 4 and 5 completely separate; posterior corners in dorsal view triangular; as short rounded lobes in lateral view (
Fig. 1
A–B). Urosome of 4 somites (
Fig. 1
D, F). Spermathecae of moderate size, slightly upturned anteriorly (
Fig. 1
E–G). Caudal rami with 1 dorsal seta, 1 ventral seta, and 4 terminal setae.

Antennule (
Fig. 2
A–B) nearly as long as body, or extending to caudal rami, of 24 articulating segments; armature as follows:
I– 3
s, II–
IV– 6
s + 1 ae,
V– 2
s + 1 ae,
VI– 2
s,
VII– 2
s + 1 ae,
VIII– 2
s,
IX– 2
s + 1 ae, X–
XI– 4
s + 1 ae,
XII– 1
s, XIII– 1 ? (scar, setal element was broken) XIV– 2 s + 1 ae, XV– 1 s, XVI– 2 s + 1 ae, XVII– 1 ?, XVIII– 1 s + 1 ?, XIX– 1 s, XX– 2 s, XXI– 1 s + 1 ae, XXII– 1 s, XXIII– 1 s, XXIV– 2 s, XXV– 2 s, XXVI– 2 s, XXVII–XXVIII– 5 s + 1 ae.

Antenna (
Fig. 2
C), coxa with 1 seta, basis with 2 setae, one seta very short; exopod of 7 segments with 0, 0- 0- 1, 1 , 1, 1 , 1, 1 , and 3 setae; first endopodal segment with 1 seta, second with 8 + 6 setae.

Mandible (
Fig. 2
D–E), gnathobase without crest, cutting edge with 4 large and 4 small teeth near dorsal seta; basis with 3 setae; exopod 5 -segmented with 1, 1 , 1, 1 , and 2 setae; endopod segment 1 with 2 setae, segment 2 with 9 setae.

Maxillule (
Fig. 3
A–B), praecoxal arthrite with 9 marginal, 4 posterior and 1 anterior setae, distalmost praecoxal arthrite terminal seta curved at apex; coxal endite with 4 setae; coxal epipodite with 7 long and 2 short setae; proximal basal endite with 4 setae, distal basal endite with 4 setae; endopod with 9 ( 3 + 6 ) setae; exopod with 8 setae.

Maxilla (
Fig. 3
C–D), praecoxal endite (previously considered as proximal praecoxal endite) with 5 setae; coxal endite (previously considered as distal praecoxal endite) with 3 setae; basal endites (previously considered as coxal endites) with 3 setae each, 1 seta of proximal basal endite sensory, worm-like; enditic-like lobe of proximal endopodal segment (previously considered as proximal basal endite) with 4 setae, 2 sensory, worm-like; setae of the maxilla basal endites and enditic-like lobe of endopod are similar in shape and size, curved and curled distally; endopod with 3 worm-like and 5 brush-like sensory setae and 1 small sclerotized seta.

Maxilliped (
Fig. 3
E, 4 A), syncoxa with 1 sclerotized seta on proximal praecoxal endite, 2 sclerotized setae on middle praecoxal endite and 3 sclerotized setae, distalmost with poorly developed brush on distal praecoxal endite; coxal lobe with 3 setae. Basis with 3 proximal setae and 2 distal setae. Endopod 5 -segmented with 4, 4 , 3, 3 + 1 , and 4 setae.

Swimming legs. P 1 (
Fig. 2
F), coxa with medial spinules; basis with medial spinules and small posterior denticles at base of medial distal seta curved with setules; endopod 1 -segmented with lateral lobe, lateral margin without spinules; exopod segments 1 to 3 with 1 lateral spine each, spines of exopod segments 1 and 2 thin distally. P 2 –P 4 (
Fig. 4
B–D), coxa with 1 seta; basis without seta, with small denticles distomedially; endopod 2 -segmented in P 2 , with posterior spinules, 3 -segmented in P 3 –P 4 with posterior spinules; exopods 3 -segmented. Posterior surface of P 4 coxo-, basi, and exopod spinulated.

P 5 (
Fig. 1
H) 3 -segmented, composed of coxa, basis and 1 -segmented exopod; coxa slightly more elongate than basis; coxa with sparse small spinules distolaterally, basis with distolateral patch of spinules, exopod ornamented with dense surface spinules, 4 distal spines partly or completely separate from segment, medial spine longest.
Etymology. The species name refers to the chronological sequence in which this species was discovered for the genus.
